alert.note: Alert for Mayes (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 3:31AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following county, Mayes. * WHEN...Until 645 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 331 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Chouteau... Locust Grove... Salina... Langley... Adair... Spavinaw... Disney... Pensacola... Hoot Owl... Sportsmen Acres Community... Spavinaw State Park... Rose... Cherokee State Park... Strang... Snowdale State Park... Murphy... Mazie... Disney Little Blue State Park... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
